items.title: The indiscriminate adoption of AI threatens the foundations of academia
items.summary: arXiv:2602.10165v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Artificial intelligence offers much promise, but its use in scientific research should be restrained so that the primary aim of academia -- advancing knowledge for humans -- is safeguarded.

items.title: Cosmo3DFlow: Wavelet Flow Matching for Spatial-to-Spectral Compression in Reconstructing the Early Universe
items.summary: arXiv:2602.10172v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Reconstructing the early Universe from the evolved present-day Universe is a challenging and computationally demanding problem in modern astrophysics. We devise a novel generative framework, Cosmo3DFlow, designed to address dimensio…

items.title: Statistical isotropy of the universe and the look-elsewhere effect
items.summary: arXiv:2602.10178v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recently, Jones et al. [arXiv:2310.12859] claimed strong evidence for the statistical anisotropy of the universe. The claim is based on a joint analysis of four different anomaly tests of the cosmic microwave background data, each o…
